alert.note: Alert for Addison; Orange; Washington (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 10 at 6:00PM EDT until July 10 at 9:00PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: The National Weather Service in Burlington has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... East Central Addison County in central Vermont... Northwestern Orange County in central Vermont... Southern Washington County in central Vermont... * Until 900 PM EDT. * At 600 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain across the warned area. Between 3 and 6 inches of rain have fallen. The expected rainfall rate is 0.5 to 1 inch in 1 hour. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1.5 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Heavy rain producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Barre, Montpelier, Berlin, E F Knapp State Airport, Northfield Village, Williamstown, Barre City, Northfield, Barre Town, Websterville, Brookfield, East Montpelier, Moretown, Middlesex, Roxbury, Washington, Plainfield, Waitsfield, Orange and Chelsea. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...0.5-1 INCH IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
